errors.error_description: The conda installation guide incorrectly states that the Qt requirement is not automatically installed, leading to an unnecessary, separate `conda install pyqt5` command.
correction_candidates: Restore the original text: "**Note:** If the Qtconsole is installed using conda, it will **automatically** install the Qt requirement as well." and remove the `conda install pyqt5` command.
Change the command to `conda install qtconsole pyqt5`.
Change the text to: "**Note:** Conda may install the Qt requirement, but it is best to install it explicitly."
Change the command to `conda install qtconsole -c conda-forge`.
errors.golden_answer: Restore the original text: "**Note:** If the Qtconsole is installed using conda, it will **automatically** install the Qt requirement as well." and remove the `conda install pyqt5` command.

errors.error_description: A critical note explaining that `pip` does not automatically install the Qt dependency has been removed, making the instructions unclear and likely to fail for users.
correction_candidates: Add the note back: "**Note:** Make sure that Qt is installed. Unfortunately, Qt is not installed when using pip. The next section gives instructions on doing it."
Change the `pip install qtconsole` command to `pip install qtconsole[pyqt5]`.
Add a sentence: "After this, you must install a Qt binding like PyQt5 separately."
Add a link to the "Installing Qt" section right after the command.
errors.golden_answer: Add the note back: "**Note:** Make sure that Qt is installed. Unfortunately, Qt is not installed when using pip. The next section gives instructions on doing it."
